meanings.definition: Feel or express great loathing for
meanings.sent1: I execrate the taste of brussels sprouts.
meanings.sent2: She would often execrate the rainy weather.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to execrate the new brand of cat food.
meanings.sent4: The old man would execrate the noisy neighbors every night.
meanings.sent5: The students would execrate the upcoming exam with dread.

meanings.sent1: He would execrate anyone who dared to betray him.
meanings.sent2: The witch would execrate those who crossed her path.
meanings.sent3: The toddler would execrate his vegetables at dinner time.
meanings.sent4: The villagers would execrate the dark forest as a place of evil.
meanings.sent5: The pirate captain would execrate any crew member who disobeyed his orders.
